alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 12:29AM CDT until August 12 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Hancock County in west central Illinois... Southeastern Clark County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 1229 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Antioch, or 10 miles south of Kahoka, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Winchester and St. Patrick around 1240 AM CDT. Gregory Landing around 1250 AM CDT. Alexandria around 1255 AM CDT. Warsaw, Sutter and Tioga around 100 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include St. Patrick, Gregory Landing, Winchester, Antioch, Tioga and Sutter. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
